arts.ttl: 'Always goes to the wire' - Leeds boss Farke calls for calm
arts.sum: Leeds boss Daniel Farke says his Championship leaders will have to continue to "prove themselves" after taking just one point from their past two games.

arts.ttl: Huge wins for Coventry and Portsmouth - weekly football quiz
arts.sum: Test yourself on what's been going on over the past week in football.

arts.ttl: ‘Congratulations to Portsmouth’: Leeds United boss acknowledges Fortress Fratton challenge as he rues missed chances
arts.sum: Daniel Farke rued his side’s profligacy as he recognised the test of stepping into bearpit Fratton Park.

arts.ttl: Vindicated: Portsmouth boss' joy as much-criticised team selection silences prolific Leeds
arts.sum: John Mousinho is convinced his centre-half selection was vindicated after free-scoring Leeds were shut out for just the seventh time this season.

arts.ttl: 'Always goes to the wire' - Farke calls for calm
arts.sum: Leeds boss Daniel Farke says his Championship leaders will have to continue to "prove themselves" after taking just one point from their past two games.

arts.ttl: ‘Greatest performance I have ever seen’ - the Portsmouth hero taking all the praise after Leeds United triumph
arts.sum: Pompey fans have taken to social media to praise Nicolas Schmid.

arts.ttl: Leeds United blame game begins as Piroe fluffs his lines in Portsmouth setback
arts.sum: The defeat - United’s fourth of the league season - opens the door for Burnley and Sheffield United to jump ahead of Leeds on Tuesday. Farke said the table will tell its own story at the end of the season although admitted he didn’t want to take away from the frustration supporters will feel after the result.

arts.ttl: Pompey 1-0 Leeds: Farke to blame on Aaronson decision
arts.sum: Daniel Farke has to take the brunt of criticism for Leeds United’s 1-0 defeat at Portsmouth, despite individual moments costing the Whites at Fratton Park. A raucous home crowd backing an intense John Mousinho side, combined with Leeds missing golden opportunities, a poor refereeing display, and some uncharacteristic sub-par performances – meant that Daniel Farke was tasting defeat for the first time since November.
